channel.title: [PI] Help comparing/checking ip's?
channel.description: I think some people are screwing with me trying to get me to give them stuff on my server and i just cannot for the life of me figure out how to check their ip's on 2 acc's to see if its the same person just on 2 different clients.. Anyone can please help me find out how? Thank you so much :D

item.title: [PI] Help comparing/checking ip's?
item.dc:creator: @aaronmead aaronmead
item.description:
@aaronmead wrote:

IP ban one of them. Then see if the other one stays on. Then Un-IPban if you want to

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] Help comparing/checking ip's?
item.dc:creator: @zerogordo zerogordo
item.description:
@zerogordo wrote:

[quote=“I Vain I”][quote author=zerogordo link=topic=473103.msg3460542#msg3460542 date=1294440730]

[quote author=I Vain I link=topic=473103.msg3459883#msg3459883 date=1294373436]

They should have the same IP in the char folder lol
[/quote]IPs aren’t stored, but it’s easy to store them.

Well not ips but the doesn’t it store a generalized host isp in character file?
[/quote]Not in PI.

You can easily create a token, as the variable is predefined as connectedFrom.[/quote]

never really learned what PI was or got into it lol.

Read full topic
